title: L.A. sees 4th most dog attacks on USPS postal workers; CA ranked 1st among states
summary:
Postal Service’s list of dog attacks on mail carriers last year.
The service on Thursday released rankings of 2021 dog attacks by city as part of National Dog Bite Prevention Week.
Postal Service.
Last year, many attacks reported by letter carriers came from dogs whose owners regularly stated, “My dog won’t bite,” according to USPS.
When a carrier feels unsafe, mail service could be halted — not only for the dog owner, but for the entire neighborhood, according to USPS.
